pr_title: LUCENE-9321: Refactor renderJavadoc to allow relative links with multiple Gradle tasks

timeline.message: LUCENE-9321: Refactor renderJavadocs to allow relative links with multiple Gradle tasks
Refer to our current task name to build up dependencies on output files of other renderJavadocs runs

timeline.bodyText: To generate relative links, have you considered to use -link (as the original ant task does so) option instead of -linkoffline ? The first version of "renderJavadoc" had also used -link option with relative file paths before we changed it to absolute urls. (I'm not sure if it makes sense here and have no strong feeling with that, but -link seems to be more safe since with the option javadoc tool checks if the files to be linked exist on the local machine.)
timeline.author: mocobeta

replies.bodyText:
Ah thanks. I will look into this. From what I have seen as output the links were generated correctly.
So I will use -link if the boolean flag enables relative links, otherwise -linkoffline. I will check the ANT task, too.
